headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; OFFICERS APPOINTED BY THE COMMON COUNCIL. DEATHS. COUNTY CLERK.

docs.lead_paragraph: CIL.--City Clerk--Joseph Hegeman. Health Officer--Mathew Wendell, M.D., old incumbent. City Treasurer --A. S. Malford. Messenger and Keeper of the City Hall Robert Howard, old incumbent. Keeper of City Parks--George Doherty, Whig. Sealer of Weighs and Measures--Thomas Petit. Bell-Ringers--James Dillon, William Krily; latter Whig.

headline.main: ONE DAY LATHER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE GLASGOW. THE FINANCIAL PROSPECTS. IMPORTANT MOVEMENTS IN INDIA. THE INSURRECTION IN CHINA. ENGLAND Discussions on the Budget. Miscellaneous. FRANCE. Manufacturing Industry. SPAIN. ITALY. Political sentences. Overland Mail--Confustions in India. CHINA. Success of the Insurgents. COMMERCIAL INTELLIGENCE. Markets. London Corn Market London Produce Market Liverpool Cotton Market Liverpool Sugar Market Glasrow Cotton Market Glasgow Pig-Iron Market

docs.lead_paragraph: The British propeller Glasgow, Capt. R. CRAIG, arrived at this port yesterday from Glasgow, with dates from that port to the 16th Dec., and London to the 15th-one day later than the advices per Pacific, The news by the overland Mail is important as regards the condition of affairs in India ,and China.

headline.main: HISTORY OF 1852.; POLITICAL AND GENERAL HISTORY OF THE Principal Nations of the World. PART IV. EUROPEAN,

docs.lead_paragraph: THE GERMANIC CONFEDERATION. The political history of Central Europe for the last two years hinges entirely upon the rivalry between Austria and Prussia for the supremacy in Germany. Two years ago the question seemed about to be decided by arms, and some trifling hostilities took place which appeared to be the inevitable precursors of a general war.

docs.lead_paragraph: We regret to be called on to announce the death of one of our most valued and respected citizens, AMOS LAWRENCE, Esq., of the firm of A. A. LAWRENCE Co This event took place at 12 1/4 o'clock last night. He retired in his usual health last evening, and about midnight he experienced one of those spasmodic affections in the stomach to which, for many years, he had been subject.

docs.lead_paragraph: REV. JOHN SCOBLE.--This gentleman, so long distinguished as one of the leaders of the British and Foreign Anti Slavery Society, has lately arrived in New York, with his family, on this way, we believe, to Canada, where he proposes to settle, The British and Foreign Anti Slavery Committee signified their high appreciation of his services by the passage of the following resolution:
